docs.title: Welcome to the Hackathon Documentation
docs.text:
This site contains the documentation automatically generated from our sample-project code.

Use the navigation bar on the left to view the functions in main.py and utils.py.

docs.title: main.py
docs.text:
Calculates the area of a rectangle.

Args:
    length (float): Length of the rectangle.
    width (float): Width of the rectangle.

Returns:
    float: The area computed as length multiplied by width.

Determines whether a given integer is strictly positive.

Args:
    number (int): The integer to evaluate.

Returns:
    bool: `True` if `number` is greater than 0; otherwise `False`.

docs.title: utils.py
docs.text:
def add(a: int, b: int) -> int:
    """
    Return the sum of two integers.

    Args:
        a (int): The first integer.
        b (int): The second integer.

    Returns:
        int: The sum of `a` and `b`.
    """
    return a + b

def get_user_greeting(username: str) -> str:
    """
    Generate a personalized greeting message.

    Args:
        username (str): The name of the user.

    Returns:
        str: A greeting string, e.g., "Hello, <username>!".
    """
    return f"Hello, {username}!"
